result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquille T Troutman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel, Karen M. and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 4 months at the House of Correction - consecutive - straight time - with 4 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  9 months - consecutive to time now being served.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) AODA, treatment or program. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.

Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in custody.  
Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pretrial.  Hearing proceeded.  Amended Information submitted by the state.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and stands silent as to plea as the parties are prepared to proceed to plea hearing.  

Charge amended to COUNT 1: POSSESSION OF TETRAHYDROCANNABINOLS (THC), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Elements received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Jury trial calendared for 9-14-15 removed from the calendar.  Any written statements on behalf of the defendant to be submitted immediately before the hearing.  Case adjourned to 9-14-15 at 10:00 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing before Branch 44.
Justice Point discharge summary report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests a trial date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 9/11/2015 at 10:00, and for jury trial on 9/16/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 44.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/11/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to continue with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Zachary Wittchow for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/6/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shaquille T Troutman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
